, here are some things that may help you:
Magics:
%edwin - This is me, please read in a proper Acquired Queens English accent
Some helpful tips from your favorite butler
%edwin_data - This is also me, reading, in an English Accent, which data sources you have defined,
%edwin_vis  - Information regarding visualizations available to you
Some helpful Magics:
%readfile - Take a path and display the results
%%newNotebook - Takes a path and creates a new notebook returning a link.
Python Functions:
runSpark(sql) : Run the specified SQL using the Spark Hive Context return a schema RDD
runHive(sql) : Run the specified SQL using HiveServer2 and return a JSON representation
retSparkJson(collected) : Return the collected Spark Schema RDD as JSON as outputed by runSpark
md5(data) : Return the hexdigest md5
Results of data magics
prev_file  : Stores the contents of the previous file read with %readfile
prev_spark : Stores the raw (as returned from spark) results of the previous spark magic command
prev_hive : Stores the raw (as returned from hive) results of the previous hive magic command
